}

prs.title: op-supervisor: add custom toml methods to StaticConfigDependency
prs.truncated_body:
# Overview
The superchain-registry uses toml files for chain configs. We want a standard way to encode and decode interop depsets into those files. This pr adds custom `UnmarshalTOML` and `MarshalTOML` methods to `StaticConfigDependency,` which is the struct we will write into those files.

The superchain-registry will import and use the `StaticConfigDependency` struct.

# Related issues
Clo

prs.title: op-deployer: use op-supervisor StaticConfigDependencySet struct
prs.truncated_body:
Prior to this pr devnet-sdk and op-deployer used a custom `DependencySet` struct that lived in devnet-sdk. This was awkward for op-deployer (a production component) to import from devnet-sdk (a testing sdk), and could lead to circular dependencies in the future.

This pr updates both packages such that they import and use the standard op-supervisor `StaticConfigDependencySet` struct instead. Thi

prs.title: Refactor transaction meta and results.
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

This has a high level goal of encapsulating and obviating the transaction meta building and result management logic as much as possible. Results should contain the data and logic that influences the ledger hash, while meta contains purely optional data that doesn't need to be stored on validator nodes.

Most of this change is functionally no-op. The only two functional changes a

commits.message:
Refactor transaction meta and results.

This has a high level goal of encapsulating and obviating the transaction meta building and result management logic as much as possible. Results should contain the data and logic that influences the ledger hash, while meta contains purely optional data that doesn't need to be stored on validator nodes.

Most of this change is functionally no-op. The only functional change is the fix for the failed fee bump transaction replay shortcut (currently fee bumps are never skipped even if we use the results from replay).

- SorobanData
  - This struct is removed as it contained a mix of meta and non-meta
  - RefundableFeeTracker introduced for tracking the refundable resources
  - Return value and consumed non-refundable fee moved to meta
- MutableTransactionResult
  - Use unique_ptr/references to store/pass results around
  - Store just a single result XDR instead of 2 nested XDRs for fee bumps
  - Move common logic to the base class
  - Provide only minimum necessary mutating interface (no more direct mutable access to underlying XDR)
  - Clarify and enforce the invariants - success result may only become error, error may not be modified
  - Provide more descriptive factory methods (e.g. create errors directly in validation)
- TransactionMetaFrame
  - TransactionMetaFrame is now test-only view interface for meta. The meta building functionality is moved to TransactionMetaBuilder
  - Also introduce OperationMetaBuilder for building operation meta
  - All the tx meta is owned by TransactionMetaBuilder (including the events, Soroban-specific meta etc.)
  - Provide a way to disable populating the meta which minimizes the amount of meta-related work on validators (including not getting the ledger changes from LTX)
  - Encapsulate meta finalization logic based on the final status of the transaction
 - EventManagers
  - Renamed DiatnosticEventBuffer to DiagnosticEventManager for consistency and make the interface more consistent
  - All the event managers can be conditionally enabled/disabled
  - Operation and Transaction event managers may only be instantiated by the respective meta builders
  - Remove some redundant methods and members
Regenerate LCM to pick up optional return value change.

prs.title: Prover: richer exit code to better detect completeness issues
prs.truncated_body:
The PR extends the number of cases where a 77 may be triggered
* When keccak overflows
* When vector builder are used
* When too many state merkle proofs

The exiting automatically gives a stack trace to help debugging

The PR also introduces the exit code 78, which triggers when constraints are unsatisfied. It can be fired by
* mpts.Prover if a quotient does not cancel
* lookup.Prover fa

commits.message: feat(exit): make sure that keccak uses 77 when overflowing and not a panic message
feat(exit): makes PadAssign return a 77 when vector builder overflows
feat(exit): adds a toggle mechanism for the exiting strategy
feat(unsatisfied): adds exiting when encountering an unsatisfied constraint
adds the toggle for the exit when finding unsatisfied constraints
feat(77): uses the 77 exit code to tell when we have too many merkle proofs
